content:
Legal Information: Landlords/agents in England must check a prospective tenant’s right to rent before the tenancy starts and keep records. Checks can be manual, via the Home Office online service, or by approved identity service providers, following the latest Home Office guidance.

Tags: lettings, checks, id

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: right_to_rent_england

content:
Legal Information: Under the Tenant Fees Act 2019 most upfront tenant charges are banned (e.g., admin, inventory, referencing). Permitted payments are limited (rent, refundable deposit, capped default fees, etc.). Local authorities can enforce and issue penalties.

Tags: lettings, fees

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: tenant_fees_act_2019

content:
Legal Information: Landlords must give tenants the latest “How to Rent: the checklist for renting in England” at the start of most assured shorthold tenancies (hard copy or PDF by agreement). Failing to do so can affect service of a valid no-fault notice under current law.

Tags: lettings, documents

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: how_to_rent_must_provide

content:
Legal Information: An Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) is required before marketing a property for sale or rent (limited exemptions apply, e.g., certain protected buildings). EPCs are generally valid for 10 years.

Tags: sales, lettings, epc

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: epc_required_marketing

content:
Legal Information: Assured shorthold tenancy deposits must be protected in a government-approved TDP scheme, and prescribed information must be given to the tenant within 30 days. Non-compliance risks penalties and limits on regaining possession.

Tags: lettings, deposit

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: deposit_protection_and_pi

content:
Legal Information: Private rented homes must meet the Electrical Safety Standards in the Private Rented Sector (England) Regulations 2020: an electrical installation condition report (EICR) by a qualified person at least every 5 years, with remedial works as required.

Tags: lettings, safety, electrical

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: electrical_safety_eicr_5y

content:
Legal Information: Landlords must ensure annual gas safety checks on each appliance/flue by a Gas Safe registered engineer and provide the record to tenants before move-in or within 28 days of the check. Ongoing maintenance duties apply.

Tags: lettings, safety, gas

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: gas_safety_annual_cp12

content:
Legal Information: From 1 Oct 2022: at least one smoke alarm on each storey used as living accommodation; a carbon monoxide alarm in any room with a fixed combustion appliance (excluding gas cookers); landlords must repair/replace once reported.

Tags: lettings, safety, alarms

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: smoke_co_alarms_2022

content:
Legal Information: For periodic ASTs, landlords typically can raise rent no more than once a year using a Section 13 notice (Form 4). For fixed-term ASTs, increases must be agreed or provided for in the contract; otherwise apply after the term ends.

Tags: lettings, rent

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: rent_increases_section13_basics

content:
Legal Information: Buyers may owe Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT). Check the current residential rates and use the official calculator; surcharges may apply (e.g., additional properties, non-residents).

Tags: buying, tax, finance

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: sdlt_basic_rates_and_calc

content:
Legal Information: Council Tax bands are set by the VOA. You can check a property’s band online and see how assessments work; band challenges follow VOA processes.

Tags: occupancy, council_tax

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: council_tax_bands_how_to_check

content:
Legal Information: Manchester runs selective licensing in designated areas for PRS homes (5-year designations). Landlords operating in these areas must obtain a licence and comply with licence conditions.

Tags: licensing, landlords, prs

Jurisdiction: Manchester City Council

metadata.source_title: manchester_selective_licensing_overview

content:
Legal Information: Current selective licensing schemes cover specific streets/areas across wards such as Rusholme, Cheetham, Longsight, Moss Side, Miles Platting & Newton Heath, Levenshulme, Gorton & Abbey Hey, etc. Always check the live list before letting.

Tags: licensing, areas

Jurisdiction: Manchester City Council

metadata.source_name: Manchester City Council – Current selective licensing schemes
metadata.source_title: manchester_selective_licensing_current_areas

content:
Legal Information: Salford operates selective licensing in defined areas (e.g., Eccles, Barton & Winton; other designations over time). Landlords in these areas must hold a valid licence; see maps and apply online.

Tags: licensing, landlords, prs

Jurisdiction: Salford City Council

metadata.source_name: Salford City Council – Selective licensing areas
metadata.source_title: salford_selective_licensing

content:
Legal Information: Salford publishes a register of properties with a selective landlord licence (with addresses and licence dates). Useful to verify licensed status before purchase or letting.

Tags: licensing, register

Jurisdiction: Salford City Council

metadata.source_name: Salford City Council – Selective licence register (PDF)
metadata.source_title: salford_selective_licensing_register

content:
Legal Information: Mandatory HMO licensing applies to properties with 5+ occupants forming 2+ households (national rule). Manchester currently has no citywide additional HMO licensing but may introduce or consult on schemes; check council pages for updates.

Tags: HMO, licensing

Jurisdiction: Manchester City Council

metadata.source_title: manchester_hmo_mandatory

content:
Legal Information: In Manchester, an Article 4 Direction removes permitted development rights for changing a dwellinghouse to a small HMO in many areas; planning permission is required to let to more than two unrelated people where Article 4 applies.

Tags: planning, HMO, article4

Jurisdiction: Manchester City Council

metadata.source_title: manchester_article4_small_hmo

content:
Legal Information: Salford has Article 4 directions covering parts of the city that remove permitted development rights for converting C3 homes to small HMOs (C4). From 17 Nov 2024 planning permission is required in the designated areas; check the map.

Tags: planning, HMO, article4

Jurisdiction: Salford City Council

metadata.source_name: Salford City Council – Article 4 directions for small HMOs
metadata.source_title: salford_article4_small_hmo

content:
Legal Information: Buying at auction is legally binding on the fall of the hammer. Review the auction legal pack (conditions of sale, special conditions, title, searches) and seek legal advice before bidding; once sold, completion deadlines and fees apply.

Tags: auctions, buying, due_diligence

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_title: auctions_consumer_guide_rics

content:
Legal Information: The Leasehold Reform (Ground Rent) Act 2022 restricts ground rent on most new long residential leases to a peppercorn (zero monetary rent). Different commencement rules apply to retirement housing.

Tags: leasehold, ground_rent

Jurisdiction: England & Wales

metadata.source_title: leasehold_ground_rent_new_leases

content:
Legal Information: Policy note: Government intends to abolish Section 21 ‘no-fault’ evictions via the Renters’ Rights Bill, moving to periodic tenancies and revised grounds. As of Aug 2025, check official bill progress—elements are not yet fully in force.

Tags: lettings, policy_status

Jurisdiction: England

metadata.source_name: UK Parliament – Renters’ Rights Bill progress
